H0.text: Beach erosion is an environmental issue directly contributed to by the burning of coal, which generates about 53 % of the electrical energy in the United States.

H1.text: Ozone depletion is directly contributed to by the burning of coal, which is used to generate about 53% of the electrical energy in the United States.

H2.text: Overfishing is the environmental issue directly contributed to by the burning of coal, which is used for generating about 53 % of the electrical energy in the United States.

H3.text: Air pollution is the environmental issue directly contributed to by the burning of coal, which is used for generating about 53 % of the electrical energy in the United States.

A4.text: burning fuel to generate electricity causes air pollution; lignite and coal produce the most air pollution, followed by oil, and then by fossil gas and biomass.

A5.text: PM2.5 formed from emissions from coal-fired power plants could be more harmful than other types of fine particulate matter.
